timeline.message: Validate nullable is not used on primite parameters. Fixes #3666
Validate nullable is not used on primite parameters. Fixes #3666

timeline.bodyText: We need to ensure the MethodElement is annotated with @Executable. Can you look into why TypeElementVisitor<Object, Executable> is not working?
timeline.author: jameskleeh

replies.bodyText: If we can limit this as much as possible to a pair of meta annotations it is better for incremental compilation
replies.author: graemerocher

replies.bodyText:
@jameskleeh fixed now. See my comment: #3698 (comment) and 5197f8a.
@graemerocher Can you please explain what do you mean? I've pushed a commit that makes it work with TypeElementVisitor<Object, Executable>. Do you mean making it for something that it's not Object? Like  TypeElementVisitor<Any-other-thing-here, Executable>?
replies.author: ilopmar

replies.bodyText: If you have been able to limit it to just @Executable that is probably ok. In general <Object, Object> is bad for incremental compilation since it has to visit every annotation which breaks the way Gradle's incremental compilation works. Currently this is only a problem with GraalTypeElementVisitor I believe, which is the only one that visits everything (really we should try and change that visitor or restructure it to visit fewer annotations)
replies.author: graemerocher

replies.bodyText:
Thanks for the clarification.
Regarding the GraalTypeElementVisitor, if you have any idea or guidance in mind, please open an issue explaining what you have in mind and I can give it a try.
replies.author: ilopmar

timeline.bodyText: This type of scenario should still compile because Micronaut will not be executing this method
timeline.author: jameskleeh

replies.bodyText: I'm sorry James, you are right. I was confused at the beginning and didn't really think about the difference on "user calling it's own code" vs "Micronaut calling user code" (like in a controller). It's fixed now.
replies.author: ilopmar

timeline.message: Change the error to a warning
